sub_title: Assistant Professor at Laboratory of Phytopathology,Wageningen UR
summary:
As a scientist, I have been involved in fundamental and applied research with strong multidisciplinary characters, applying biotechnology, molecular biology and biochemistry, within plant-microbe interactions, biocontrol, mycology, biodiversity and molecular ecology. 
I am used to working in projects, taking care of the financial management, publications and  progress reports and presentations for stakeholders and other scientists from industry and research institutes. 
I guide PhD, MSc and BSc students, at both theoretical and practical level, who describe me as a very good and dedicated coach, keeping them focused and in control and getting the maximum out of the research. I provide them with both the bigger picture and the (technical) details concerning research and writing.

education.field_of_study: Title: “Plants and microorganisms: Complex checks and balances in tritrophic interactions”
Thesis: "Plantibodies - Requirements for expression and subcellular targeting"​

authors.headline: Assistant Professor at Laboratory of Phytopathology,Wageningen UR

profile_positions.location: Laboratory of Nematology, Experimental Plant Sciences
profile_positions.description:
•	Writing scientific publications
•	Book editor
•	Evaluating teaching programs
•	Consulting with respect to microbial aspects associated with integrated pest management, plant nutrition, growth and development. 
•	Guiding students during research projects
•	Coaching students writing their PhD-thesis 
•	Presenting research at universities and meetings
profile_positions.title: Guest Scientist at Wageningen UR and Consultant for HGoTECH (Bonn, Germany)

profile_positions.description:
•	Coordinating and directing molecular ecological research on plant beneficial microbes for the biological control of diseases and pests in agriculture 
•	Writing scientific papers
•	Writing project proposals
•	Coaching and motivating students during their Bachelor, Master and PhD research projects
•	Managing project budgets
•	Lecturing on molecular, biochemical and ecological aspects of plant pathology and the biological control of plant diseases and pests
•	Managing molecular and biochemical laboratory (S1 level)
•	Managing institute IT network and equipment for co-workers and students
